result.execSummary:
The defendant Amy Lynn Wiorek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA Specimen and to pay mandatory DNA surcharge by 4-8-2016. If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant. Defendant is advised that they may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if they meet the conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
Court WAIVED all other costs and surcharges because of defendant's financial situation.
Concurrent with: to any other sentence. Huber for work, treatment, and child care.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amy Lynn Wiorek

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Amy Lynn Wiorek in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Amy Lynn Wiorek in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
Defendant ordered to serve 60 days in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to any other sentence with credit of (0) days Time served, with Huber privileges for work, treatment, and child care. 
Court ordered defendant to Defendant ordered to provide DNA Specimen and to pay mandatory DNA surcharge by 04-8-2016.  If unpaid, a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant. 
Defendant is advised that they may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if they meet the conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).,
Court WAIVED all other costs and surcharges because of defendant's financial situation. 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk jks

Defendant Amy Lynn Wiorek in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.   Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 46. jks
  Calendar call scheduled for 04-08-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Amy Lynn Wiorek not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case to be resolved with defendants other pending matter, 14CM4123.  Status conference scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Wal-Mart, 10600 W. Layton Ave.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Amy Lynn Wiorek in court with attorney Steven R. Wiechmann.  Defendant Amy Lynn Wiorek in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
